title: Safely Utilizing Animal Manure and Compost on Small Produce Farms: a Montana Perspective

tasks.task: Coordinating Nutrient Management for Small Farms
subtasks: Networking with presenters to integrate practical extension perspectives
Gratitude to original co-author and Montana presenter
Understanding Montana's agricultural landscape (primarily cow-calf, beef backgrounding, dairies, hog CAFOs)
Assessing nutrient management within the state, considering manure nutrient utilization and export
Exploring common manure application practices (conventional crop and forage ground, composting, mining reclamation projects)
Identifying emerging opportunities for manure use in small produce farms and market gardens
